abstracts.cdata!:
The medium-term objective of the Malaria
            Control Project is to help India create an enhanced and more
            effective malaria control program that uses a better mix of
            effective malaria control interventions responsive to local
            needs; and strengthen the Directorate of the National
            Malaria Eradication Program (NMP) and modifies its
            orientation. The long-term objective is to reduce death,
            morbidity and social and economic losses from malaria. The
            project will include the following five components: 1) an
            integrated early detection and prompt treatment of clinical
            cases component; 2) a selective vector component; 3) a
            medicated mosquito net program component; 4) an epidemic
            response and intersectoral collaboration component; and 5)
            an institutional strengthening component.
